post.body: - I'm posting about SugarSync on couchworkers right now. You should really try it. I was migrating to it anyhow, so this cinches it
- No worries, always more interesting than reading a copy/paste of my press release ;-)
- re: KB toys - dang, hate to see anything close like that. But KB's been barely holding on for years
- you're not missing much if you haven't seen it yet
- and a response on how to price your apps in the store - http://tinyurl.com/68m4nc
- I assume that's not the new Mac that died?
- be sure to check out Galcon. It's not coop, but it's the best example of Internet multiplayer on iphone I think so far
NY loves to tax EVERYTHING. But they keep failing when they go for digital taxes, thank heavens
- to be broadcast on ESPN 8 - The Ocho!!!!
- make a cool coop game! Nobody's make a co-op game yet
- is this in ref to their anti-embargo policy? I can see where they are coming from, for sure.
- the main streets are fine, it's the side streets that are still slushy (this morning, they were glare ice)
- watch out for those 99c and 1.99 album deals on amazon music! They are addicting
- when I say "flaky" about LEDs = they short out super easily. I had to just return $200 worth that all kept shorting out
- you can get yellow LEDs, just have to look around. However, all LED Xmas lights are so incredibly flaky
- if they did an iPhone game like Metal Gear Acid!, it could work
- him and Dora both!!!! I'd really like to have a match and a bottle of kerosene for "The Map" to talk to
- just get someone local to slap together a 99c cent app w/Maura on the toilet and you push her to fart. Instant seller
- I've seen massive delays from UPS, USPS and Fedex. The weather just trashed the shipping routes
- completely normal
- you have to use eyeglass screwdrivers on the PS3 drive bay. But it sounds like you found a workaround :-)
- you've now convinced me that I made a good choice skipping the drobo
- pray they don't switch him to Augmentin (spelling?). It kills ALL the bacteria in your body, even the helpful stuff
- I still love me a good print mag. I read Inc and Laptop religiously
- yoinks, grab some cookie dough and put it on the projectors. You'll have fresh cookies after that long meeting!
- I think in that situation, I would close my account!!! Pronto!!
- I tried it, but most of my friends are just on Fbook and Twitter, so it got old fast
- probably both
- it's amazing to watch kids play LBP. My 5-year-old actually draws his worlds on paper and recreates in-game
- yep, syncing is back to a crawl for me, also
I can't believe Little Big Planet online is still broken as all hell
BTW - the question about 500 new fans is part of a discussion I'm having with someone about the value of social media
Community folks - if you had an opp to get 500 more people interested in your product/company for free, wouldn't you take it?
Portlanders - the Peacock Lane Christmas lights start a day early this year for pedestrians only - starts Dec 14 6pm
Bummed out by the Foldershare / Windows Live Sync switchup - here's my writeup of the alternatives - http://tinyurl.com/6desf3
And now because of the new ID in "Windows Live Folder Sync" - I lost all the shared folders with clients and friends and we have to all redo
Stupid Live Foldershare update now wants me to create a Windows Live ID to use it. Forgetting the ID I've used for 2+ years now
Gotta spend the day decorating the yard and house for this - http://peacocklane.net/
Just announced a new free-to--play MMORTS "World of Battles" for PC - screens and info at Gaming Nexus - http://tinyurl.com/5god4h
Now sitting in on a client-reporter conf. call
Ahh that feels good, got a massive report off my back
Jeebus Palamino....Warfare,Inc for iphone is awesome. It's like having Starcraft done RIGHT on the device
Whew, conf. call # 3 down today, this was a really good one.
Oh Sony - don't open up that emtpy-world beta of PlayStation Home to the world - it's miserably dull
Interesting new site - http://promoappcodes.com/ - Lets reviewers and hardcore fans get app store codes for free
Wow, @GameSpotFiles must've gotten pretty hardcore about twitter today. About 10 bajillion updates, not that it's bad, mind you.
My 2 year old just spent 2 hours on the iphone game of Xmas Card tile matching. Good 99c purchase for sure
Wow, Subaru just bailed on the WRC (World Rally Championship). Guess they got sick of S. Loeb dominating them in his Citroen
My last bouncetrap review pimp on twitter :-) great review on Pocketgamer http://tinyurl.com/6pjoqr
ReadWriteWeb says "We will follow embargoes" http://tinyurl.com/4lxmrl
Anyone know why some newly installed apps don't show up on my ipod touch (Truphone and Friendsync) ?
Sacred 2 (PC)- Holiday Content Pack and updates available at www.sacred2.com
that was supposed to be "white chocolate hershey's kisses"
I may just make myself sick with this bag of Candy Cane impregnated which choco Hershey's kisses
Anyone know if there's any significant difference (besides HDD size) between the apple tv 40gb and 160gb?
So very happy the garbage trucks came today (snow's finally gone). Three weeks of garbage buildup is SCARY
EGM drops distribution in Mexico - wondering if the axe will fall in the US, and if so, will they go "all online" focusing solely on 1UP?
My 10 Best Games of 08 list http://tinyurl.com/9b99bf
Hey @Sugarsync - why is the site down with no warnings? Kind of a pain.
Damnit, Zoho's DB & Reports doesn't allow for update queries! What good is it if I can only view and add data but not change???
